summary: SUMMARY OF EXPERIENCE: Mr. Zeni has 30 years of experience in systems engineering and program management for telecommunications and information systems with NSA, the United States Air Force, White House Communications Agency and the National Reconnaissance Office. I am comfortable in leadership, managerial, and technical roles and have authored a variety of documents relevant to deployment, integration, sustainment, operations, and test. I have also worked on several proposals as author and volume lead and technical solution lead and the review process. I have been directly involved in Cloud systems and their deployment, test, security accreditation, software loading, sustainment, as well as analysis of designs, sparing, sustainment paradigms and budgeting for continued operation and technical refresh. I frequently coordinate across Lines of Business supporting new business and as Subject Matter Expert on Information Systems, DOD related, Cloud infrastructure provisioning and sustainment.

title: Principal Systems Engineer
description: CYBER TECHNOLOGY SERVICES (CTS) -October 2013 to July 2014 • Systems Engineering and Domain expertise supporting the Intelligence Community, DOD, and Whole of Government. • Technical Task Order manager and Control Account Manager (CAM) for four separate TTOs supporting the CTS program. • Approximately 66 personnel across the four TTO preforming IT support services, systems engineering and software development, ~$13.2M. • A USCYBERCOM development task supporting Enhanced Shared Situational Awareness (ESSA) with the development of a Critical Event Management System (CEMS). • Two additional software development tasks supporting malware detection and mitigation activities. • Contract successfully transitioned and fully staffed within 90 days of award.

title: Principal Systems Engineer
description: AMBIANCE program Oct 2012 to Oct 2013 Lockheed Martin Program Manager to AMBIANCE and TUNABLE programs and Cloud systems lead. LM liaison to programs coordinating TTO modifications, staff augmentation, performance, and contract actions. Deployment lead for GHOSTMACHINE systems and ICGOVCLOUD systems. Leading all deployments and mentoring junior deployment leads, coordinating schedule and requirements. Coordinated acquisition of systems and intimately familiar with system architecture and design with a thorough understanding of system processes and sustainment. I successfully led multiple teams to deploy 13 major Cloud systems from design through acquisition, build, test, security accreditation and operational acceptance. RTRG TiDS program Feb 2012 to Oct 2012 • Selected to transition a significant portion of the GHOSTMACHINE systems to the TiDS contract include geographically dispersed systems and all aspects of maintenance and support. • Organized and set up a deployment organization and sustainment organization supporting 8 new deployed systems and organized and organized and staffed the teams to a great success as recognized by the customer • Supported numerous first time instances of mission capabilities in a cloud environment by facilitating software updates, hardware maintenance, network design and configuration, security hardening and vulnerability scans and testing • Due to customer budget considerations, I also had to determine the best method of downsizing teams

summary: SUMMARY OF EXPERIENCE: Mr. Zeni has 30 years of experience in systems engineering and program management for telecommunications and information systems with NSA, the United States Air Force, White House Communications Agency and the National Reconnaissance Office. I am comfortable in leadership, managerial, and technical roles and have authored a variety of documents relevant to deployment, integration, sustainment, operations, and test. I have also worked on several proposals as author and volume lead and technical solution lead and the review process. I have been directly involved in Cloud systems and their deployment, test, security accreditation, software loading, sustainment, as well as analysis of designs, sparing, sustainment paradigms and budgeting for continued operation and technical refresh. I frequently coordinate across Lines of Business supporting new business and as Subject Matter Expert on Information Systems, DOD related, Cloud infrastructure provisioning and sustainment.

title: Deputy Chief Engineer
description: • Deputy Chief Engineer for ONDEMAND supporting GHOSTMACHINE systems and development, leading SW and HW deployments, Production and Labs, Sustainment , Security, Asset Management, CM and directly interfacing with COR and Senior leadership of the Technology Directorate, T16 customer organization. Produced systems BOMs, system and labor ROMs, Sparing analysis, Sustainment plans, Validated and approved systems engineering plans, rack elevations, wiring diagrams, power space and cooling requirements, Facility requirements supporting multiple organizations for our customer. Promoted into position from Deployment lead position. • Migrated program from a strictly Deployment organization to a Deployment and Sustainment organization setting up a Sustainment function and developing the framework to support its continued success. • Maintained, developed and organized the build and deployment of 80 individual Cloud Enabled Site Store racks deployed in increments as small a 1 rack to as large as 12 racks per deployment. • Coordinated the Factory Express process for the benefit of the customer to supply the complete racks from the outsourced integrator. This process brought the cost to the customer down from $440K per rack to just over 400K per rack. The overall savings to the customer was approximately $12M dollars from the inception of the latest 80 racks procured. • Promoted to Deployment Lead, supervising four deployment engineers and responsible for prioritizing, scheduling, deploying and sustaining 30 multi-million dollar systems to CONUS and OCONUS locations.

title: Deployment Lead/ Lead Systems Integrator
description: • Promoted from Lead Systems Integrator to Deployment lead for the SHAREDVISION LADYLOVE deployment • Developed deployment schedules, travel schedules, managed budgets, managed deployed teams • Deploying 37 rack system in two separate stages, core system first and front end system second • Developed and deployed test rack system to stand in for front end signal distribution equipment • Led and managed two Technical Task Orders- one recently extended and one ongoing through the end of the year with a value of $12.6M • Delivered 33 deliverable documents over the course of two TTO’s • Developed several sections for Management volume of successful proposal for REDSICKLE contract • Lead Systems Integration Engineer on SHAREDVISION focusing on network integration and testing of newly developed systems. • Leads a team of subcontractors providing systems integration expertise to program • Exploratory Test Lead for Beta deployment, developed process and scenarios and generated and monitored all testing on development system • Authored Spiral 1 Standard Operating Procedures, Exploratory Test Process document, Beta Spiral 2 test procedures • Developed and performed testing procedures for RJ45 prototype patch panel proving viability of panels and thereby saving the government almost $10,000 per deployed system • Provided On-the-Job training for visiting personnel- providing valuable insight and guidance on the newly deployed system • Personally oversaw the completion of the Spiral 2 installation and integration of the one of the future deployed systems

summary: SUMMARY OF EXPERIENCE: Mr. Zeni has 30 years of experience in systems engineering and program management for telecommunications and information systems with NSA, the United States Air Force, White House Communications Agency and the National Reconnaissance Office. I am comfortable in leadership, managerial, and technical roles and have authored a variety of documents relevant to deployment, integration, sustainment, operations, and test. I have also worked on several proposals as author and volume lead and technical solution lead and the review process. I have been directly involved in Cloud systems and their deployment, test, security accreditation, software loading, sustainment, as well as analysis of designs, sparing, sustainment paradigms and budgeting for continued operation and technical refresh. I frequently coordinate across Lines of Business supporting new business and as Subject Matter Expert on Information Systems, DOD related, Cloud infrastructure provisioning and sustainment.

title: Superintendent of Operations and Maintenance
company: USAF in support of National Reconnaissance Office
description: • Superintendent of Operations and Maintenance (O&M) for a 64-member joint service communications detachment, executed $400K budget and managed a $12M equipment account • Managed $8M O&M contract with 56 employees, provided input to COTR for award fee • Provided performance, cost, and schedule impacts for SIGINT engineering change proposals • Consolidated unit inputs for large RFP changing the organization and structure of O&M • Network Engineering approving authority, validated architecture for project teams • LAN/WAN engineering background with experience in Cisco routers and switches, ATM, Promina, VTC, Cryptographic equipment KG 84C, 194, 75, KY 57/58, STU III, LST 5 Satellite radio, PBX, Definity, Avaya, Mitel switches, VOIP, SCP and Newsdealer Messaging systems, and technical control centers for fractional signals and T-1, DS3, OC 3, OC48, and OC196 • In the performance of my duties a familiarity the following software was necessary: Microsoft Widows NT, XP, Project, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, Outlook, HP Openview, Remedy, Visio, AutoCAD, CISCO Internetworking Operating Systems, UNIX, SAP; Protocols: TCP/IP, DECnet, FTP, SNMP, SMTP, TFTP; Interface stds: 422, 232, 530; Cable stds Cat 5, Single/Multi mode Fiber • Ensured equipment security sanitization and compliance and accreditation via DCID 6-3

title: Senior Program Manager
description: Strategic Services Lead - Lead a team of professionals in setting strategic direction and implementing transformative changes that improve customer satisfaction and business success; maintain excellent relationships with key customer leaders and stakeholders. Capture Manager - Develop capture strategy including value proposition, win plan, proposal strategy, technical and management solution, cost and pricing model, business case and management plan. Lead capture team to produce winning proposal within budget and schedule. Senior Program Manager - Lead a team engineers, project managers and other support personnel in responding to service requests submitted by the Army Corps of Engineers customers. Responsible for relationship with the customer, solutions development, cost estimation and pricing, proposal development and managing solutions delivery. Senior Manager & Practice Lead - Lead a team of senior engineers and program managers and provide technical and management leadership to large, complex IT projects and programs. Lead technology evaluation, development, deployment, integration and test of enterprise IT solutions that meet business needs. Provide support for organizational change management. Support external initiatives leveraging corporate capabilities to win business for Lockheed Martin and its partners. Business Process Transformation Group Manager - Led a team responsible for providing Business Transformation, Process Engineering and Enterprise Technology Management Support Services to our clients. Provided consulting services to programs and customers and supported business pursuits and proposals. OMEGA® Engineering Analysis Group Manager - Managed a group that provides enterprise portfolio management and analysis support for Lockheed Martin customers. Provided value based decision analysis support enabling our customers to rationalize investment portfolios.

description: Senior Program Manager - Led international, cross functional teams through the product development process. Develop business cases and manage programs within schedule, budget, revenue and profit commitments. Created and maintained program plans. Gather and review market data, work with sales channels and directly interact with customers to create innovative views of the market and product roadmap and business strategies. Product Marketing Manager - Responsible for product roadmapping and planning. Review market forecast data and customer intelligence to determine near and mid-term product strategies. This product included the world’s first single chip RF transceiver, a mixed signal IC, a digital baseband IC and embedded DSP software for the layer 1 functions.

title: Principle Senior Systems Engineer
description: Mr. Hamlin performs the duties of a Senior Systems Engineer in support of the Ambiance Program. Provides End-to-End system engineering support for many of the AMBIANCE IC Gov Cloud and GhostMachine system deployments. He provides both internal and external consulting services in addition to providing technical guidance in the development or modification of complex software programs to enhance operating systems. He works daily alongside deployment leads not only to capture system requirements but to act as the technical advisor for many of the IC Gov Cloud and GhostMachine systems. Mr. Hamlin also acts as the technical liaison between the deployment leads, customer and other organizational technical leads. All throughout his support, Mr. Hamlin became familiar in the Cloud Computing Environment with special emphasis on how the RedHat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), ACUMULO, NUWAVE, HADOOP, HDFS, MAP/REDUCE and Infrastructure Applications as well as Mission Applications can be tailored for each deployment to get the biggest bang for the buck. He developed CONOPS for three of the GhostMachine deployed systems. He performed technical research and analysis of various sustainment operations centers in the preparation of writing a white paper about ManTech developing a Cloud Operations Center (CLOC). The white paper illustrated how the CLOC will employ an Escalation process that is intended to keep senior leadership informed of any significant capability loss or SIGINT data loss on operational systems providing them necessary situational awareness for mission critical systems. Mr. Hamlin also supported the test and integration team in performing system testing, end-to-end testing, and functionality testing.
skills: ["Systems Engineering", "Information Assurance", "DoD", "Security Clearance", "Security", "Program Management", "Computer Security", "Defense", "Information Security", "Government Contracting", "MS Project", "Windows", "System Architecture"]
name: Hiram Hamlin
education: [{"name"=>"Regis University", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1999 – 2002"}, {"name"=>"University of Maryland University College", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1996 – 1998"}]
summary: Mr. Hamlin is a Senior System Engineer specializing in Full Life Cycle System Engineering, Full Life Cycle Business Process Engineering and Full Life Cycle Enterprise Architecture in support of the unique requirements of the Department of Defense. Mr. Hamlin has over 28 years professional experience in the Intelligence Community that includes 15 years of technical leadership and 15 years of Systems Engineering. Mr. Hamlin has a thorough end-to-end knowledge of information systems supporting the Intelligence Community. He understands the unique requirements of Intelligence Community systems, and has direct experience in data flows on systems used in the Intelligence Community. Mr. Hamlin has been responsible for all aspects of the System Engineering Life Cycle that include: Requirements Analysis, Requirements Development, System/Software Integration, System/Software Test, Deployment, and Sustainment. Mr. Hamlin is familiar with many processes, standards, best practices, paradigms, and tools that support the full system and software engineering life cycles. Mr. Hamlin is very familiar with lots of Process Development and Process Improvement paradigms with lots of experience providing this type of support on multiple programs. Mr. Hamlin has lots of experience developing processes from an Information Need to Operational Requirements, to Functional Requirements to Use Cases, to Test Cases and follow-on processes such as those contained in ITIL. Mr. Hamlin has many years of experience supporting the Certification and Accreditation Processes in each of the various missions.

title: Senior System Engineer
description: Mr. Hamlin performed the duties of a Senior Systems Engineer in direct support of the Director of Technology for the National Virtual Translation Center (NVTC). Mr. Hamlin provided technical direction and leadership to the IT team in this high-pressure, highly flexible environment of senior government officials. Served as a technical advisor to the director and senior managers on planning, liaison, and implementation of information technology products for the NVTC. His System Engineering duties on a daily basis consisted of both leading and supporting ongoing operational activities and identifying and integrating new priorities that increased operational efficiency and cooperative work with government customer and engineering personnel. His support to the development and production platforms includes the following: • Designed system review with government engineering personnel to ensure all requirements are met • Coordination and participation of the hardware system build-outs • Coordination and participation of software loads LINUX OS applications • Developed schedules; ensured installation personnel are available for the fabrication, deployment and installation • Worked with Government leads in the review of system design and recommended design changes, as needed, to aid hardware integration • Performed tradeoff studies on multiple hardware and software components • Provided lead technical support for problem analysis and resolution • Developed test scripts to evaluate the functionality on a Parallel Corpora proof-of-concept system • Performed system testing, beta testing, end-to-end testing, functionality testing, and compatibility testing • Integrated hardware and software components into the system test environment • Maintained the test lab and test tools, and conduct formal integration and system-level testing • Demonstrated functionality to the customer for requirements validation, and validate user documentation and deployment plans

title: Senior System Engineer
description: Mr. Hamlin served as a Technical Services Group (TSG) Systems Engineer team member responsible for managing system requirements using Telelogic DOORS database requirements tool. Mr. Hamlin primary role was to assist a government lead in coordinating system monitoring activities that touched all program components. The duties performed as the Systems Engineer/Support Engineer included the managing of four sub-contractors ensuring that the system monitoring software development milestones were tracked and on target for successful spin-cycle completion. Mr. Hamlin also produced project status and design reviews reports (documenting the design completeness and adherence to the program requirements and objectives) as well as resolving day-to-day issues with emphasis on the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). In tandem with Government led, Mr. Hamlin developed schedules and ensured installation personnel were available for the fabrication, deployment and installation of subject systems. Mr. Hamlin gathered requirements during inception phase, documented and delivered functional specification documents, and assisted architecture analysis and design using IBM’s Rational tools. He also was involved in the systems development and implementation via the use of the SDLC. Mr. Hamlin is an expert at supporting many SDLC paradigms that include: NSAWAY, AGILE, WATERFALL, STRUCTURED, TOP DOWN, BOTTOMS UP, Rational Unified Process (RUP and ITIL, and has tailored many of these in support of very large programs that include complex hardware and software that supports the customer missions and enables continuity of operations by mirroring, replications and other best practices and techniques.

title: System Engineer
description: Mr. Hamlin performed the duties of a System Architect in support NSA Enterprise Architecture Decision Support (NEADS) team. Mr. Hamlin’s duties included developing enterprise-level planning architectures, activity models, and integrated dictionaries using the Popkin System Architect software. Mr. Hamlin designed integrated systems for specifying applications, operating systems, connectivity, storage, fault tolerance, security requirements, and policies. He served as systems architect and provided ad-hoc architectural products to support the Department of Defense (DoD) Signals Intelligence Directorate (SID) and SIGINT Systems Engineering and Architecture teams. Mr. Hamlin was responsible for recognizing major architectural issues and trade-off faced when designing an enterprise solution and followed the Rational Unified Process as the primary methodology in most of his projects. Mr. Hamlin developed an Information Assurance (IA) threat model in which he reviewed the following: • IA requirements of the legacy systems • DoD Security Certification and Accreditation Process (DITSCAP) • NSA Acquisition Management Process (NISCAP) • Director of Central Intelligence (DCID) 6/3 certification and accreditation requirements Reviewing these documents enabled Mr. Hamlin to identify security gaps thus provided recommended additional requirements for certification of the Technical SIGINT Exploitation Services.

title: Visual Information Manager
description: As an active duty member of the United States Air Force, Mr. Hamlin was a Technical Lead responsible for the installation, operation and management of all secure and non-secure video teleconference communications for the North American Aerospace Defense (NORAD) and United States Space Command (USSPACECOM). Mr. Hamlin scheduled the installation and configuration of equipment into meeting rooms in a timely manner to meet program requirements; worked with presenters to organize and complete preparation for presentations; set up all Polycom bridges for meetings; weekly reported all activities; and interacted with all federal personnel. Mr. Hamlin also served as an information manager supporting the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) Publications Branch. Working alongside an Intelligence Analyst, Mr. Hamlin produced over 1,200 intelligence publications from. From the collection of nightly SIGINT message traffic, Mr. Hamlin developed daily intelligence publications in both paper and electronic formats that were disseminated to theater units around the world. In addition to Mr. Hamlin’s strong collaboration and organizational skills, his experience in the Intelligence Community and working level knowledge of intelligence networks, systems and technologies were immeasurable in ensuring the nightly dissemination of each of the Intelligence publications He performed the duties of a Communication Center Operator for the Strategic Air Command (SAC) Headquarters Watch Operations Center. His duties included the processing of message traffic and maintenance of communications and the production of SIGINT on demand reports presented daily to the SAC Commander in Chief (CINC). He also served as the Deputy Information Systems Security Officer where he coordinated the renovation and implementation of the 544th Target Material Squadron computer systems security program. He managed the acquisition, installation, physical security, and safety for hardware and software components.

name: Hiram Hamlin
education: [{"name"=>"Regis University", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1999 – 2002"}, {"name"=>"University of Maryland University College", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1996 – 1998"}]
summary: Mr. Hamlin is a Senior System Engineer specializing in Full Life Cycle System Engineering, Full Life Cycle Business Process Engineering and Full Life Cycle Enterprise Architecture in support of the unique requirements of the Department of Defense. Mr. Hamlin has over 28 years professional experience in the Intelligence Community that includes 15 years of technical leadership and 15 years of Systems Engineering. Mr. Hamlin has a thorough end-to-end knowledge of information systems supporting the Intelligence Community. He understands the unique requirements of Intelligence Community systems, and has direct experience in data flows on systems used in the Intelligence Community. Mr. Hamlin has been responsible for all aspects of the System Engineering Life Cycle that include: Requirements Analysis, Requirements Development, System/Software Integration, System/Software Test, Deployment, and Sustainment. Mr. Hamlin is familiar with many processes, standards, best practices, paradigms, and tools that support the full system and software engineering life cycles. Mr. Hamlin is very familiar with lots of Process Development and Process Improvement paradigms with lots of experience providing this type of support on multiple programs. Mr. Hamlin has lots of experience developing processes from an Information Need to Operational Requirements, to Functional Requirements to Use Cases, to Test Cases and follow-on processes such as those contained in ITIL. Mr. Hamlin has many years of experience supporting the Certification and Accreditation Processes in each of the various missions.

summary: With nearly 20 years of combined engineering experience in the public and private sectors, I have been involved in all aspects of the product development life cycle. My background includes work on proposals, systems engineering, software and hardware development support, integration, and system qualification testing. Furthermore, my past assignments have given me a perspective of not only the contractor side of the defense industry, but also that of the United States Government. Most of my experience is in systems engineering, including development of system, software, and hardware specifications, requirements analysis and decomposition, algorithm development, and modeling and simulation in MATLAB. My most recent experience is in Electronic Warfare, with assignments on United States Navy and Army programs. I hold a Top Secret security clearance. Specialties: Modeling and Simulation using MATLAB Algorithm Development Requirements Decomposition and Analysis

title: Program Manager
description: Responsible for program execution of a prime, $52M FFP, IDIQ, support services contract for a critical 24/7 operation. Responsibilities include developing technical and cost strategies for task order proposals, subcontractor management, budget execution and development of variance work off plans, interact daily with government officials to resolve issues and capture new program requirements, oversee the performance management system and career development for program employees and monitor quality metrics instituting performance improvements as necessary. Program accomplishments include the development and implementation of ~80 new processes and procedures resulting in a stabilized baseline, achieving 99% funds available for current year; analyzed and adjusted resource work load, gaining efficiencies while meeting contractual requirements and increasing profitability. Ensured compliance with LM Policies and best practices; FAR, OSHA and EPA standards.

title: Deputy Program Manager/Site Manager
description: Performed all program management functions in support of the Consolidated Infrastructure Support (CIS II) contract. CIS II was a $70M annual combined FFP and IDIQ contact with over 150 employees and 30 subcontracted companies. The contract managed over one million ft2 of 24 hour operational data center, office space and mechanical systems to include a dozen chilled water towers, nine emergency generators, food services, custodial, construction, logistics and ESH. Our staff provided 24/7 O&M support to all critical systems and facility support and I was responsible for interfacing with all customers and senior officials to provide the highest level of customer support and service to maintain this national asset. In 2009, the contract completed 90 IDIQ facility modification projects that varied in size from a low of $2000 to $2M in size. At the completion of the CIS contract, I was responsible for transitioning the personnel and functions onto the Consolidated Facilities Operations and Maintenance (CFOAM) contact; where LM is the major sub to Boeing on a cost plus award fee contract with 145 LM employees. The transition required leadership through a changing environment for both employees and the on-site customer. LM received an award fee score of 100% during the transition. I was the LM Site manager and deputy PM to the Boeing PM, continuing to provide the same high quality services that CIS II provide to the US Government.

title: Site Manager
description: I was the Site manager during the development, transition and implementation of a new international enterprise facility services contract at RAF Menwith Hill. My responsibilities included development of the Statement of Work, staffing, creation of policies/procedures and customer relations. After development of the contract, I was the Contract Senior Site Manager for the contract incorporating 65 employees and management of an UK subcontractor. As the Site Manager, I was responsible for organizational development, ensuring all customers were familiar with the new program and hiring and developing three new managers. The contract was responsible for power, space and cooling management, logistics, ESH, space planning, office personnel moves and data center renovation. We also provided engineers for design and construction management for a new 90,000 ft2 combined data center and office building.

title: Facilities Engineering and Logistics Manager
description: Managed over 50 employees in the following departments: Environmental, Health & Safety, Logistics, Property Administration, Electrical Engineering, Power & Ground, System Installation, Emergency Power, Drafting, Space Planning, Project Management, Space Planning, Facility Maintenance and employees working 24/7 help desk support. The managed employees are Lockheed Martin and UK subcontract employees. I was responsible for hiring, performance appraisals, allocation of merits, identify promotional candidates, training, mentoring, assisting employees with personal career growth, developing metrics and presenting contract performance data to customer at the PMRs. Manage the employee workload, preparation of schedules, plans, status reports, overtime and TDY support, while controlling overhead costs and managing a labor budget over $5M. Grew the technical task order part of the contract from less than one million dollars in 2004 to 2.5 million dollars in 2007. Led group in development of ISO 9001 processes and procedures and successful 9001 accreditation. Ensured that organizational performance meet program objectives of cost, reliability, quality, performance, and safety. Maintained close communications with customer to better understand expectations and manage the organization to ensure all expectations were met.

title: Staff Environmental, Health & Safety Engineer
description: On a multi-organizational site that includes personnel from several US and UK government, military, and private companies, I was responsible for EHS management and support to all personnel, regardless of their affiliation. Developed and manage an Environmental, Health and Safety program that merges the requirements of the EPA, OSHA, NFPA and their equivalent British agencies. My duties encompassed the management of the various programs, including: asbestos, fall protection, non-ionizing radiation safety, ergonomics, fire protection, chemical spill response, hazardous material management, environmental remediation, EHS audits, Indoor Air Quality investigations, noise surveys and acting as the lead for several organizational safety representatives. I was responsible for developing and managing the health and medical issues to include: provide CPR/first aid/AED instruction to Fire Department, military and civilians; point of contact and lead investigator for all accidents to determine the root cause and recommend corrective actions to prevent future occurrence. Coordinator for the site Automatic External Defibrillator program. Managed the local worker compensation program.

title: Safety & Environmental Engineer
description: Ensured compliance with EPA, OSHA, Col. Dept. of Health and NFPA regulations. Established and managed hazardous material/waste storage and disposal program including biomedical waste. Investigated UST and AST releases and prepared required reports. Performed AHERA and State of Col. asbestos building inspections. Responded to all Environmental, Safety and Health related emergencies including hazardous material releases, injuries & fatalities, and mission related equipment accidents. Performed Industrial Hygiene duties involving Indoor Air Quality, Radon, Noise and other Environmental Health assessments while providing follow-up reporting and corrective action recommendations. Certified Emergency Medical Technician and CPR/First Aid instructor and program administrator. Performed accident investigations to determine root cause and establish corrective actions. Provided Environmental, Health & Safety training to all new employees. Performed ergonomic evaluations of workstations and recommended corrective actions.

description: - Provided application training to flag level military officers and civilian government employees. - Provided executive level briefings to flag level military officers and civilian government employees on the performance and capabilities of application software. - Performed analysis of software throughout the development life-cycle and recommended upgrades and improvements. - Created instructional materials, including programs of instruction, manuals, quick reference brochures, computer assisted training programs, pre- and post-assessments, and evaluations for undocumented DoD software. - Managed a team of three software trainers, two systems administrators, one technical editor, and one configuration manager - Performed as a software trainer in a dedicated classroom and at remote on-site locations. - Performed live demonstrations of collaboration software on both SIPRnet and NIPRnet with reach-back to geographically separate servers. - Managed teams of employees traveling with technology to present products and services at conferences and seminars in a variety of venues.

summary: • 16 yrs in cyber career field: systems engineering, strategic planning, IT services mgt, communications & acquisition within the C2 and C4ISR domains • 13 yrs as 1st & 2nd line leader; mentoring, coaching, guiding, directing, military, civilian, & contractor teams of various sizes. • 12 yrs in DOD and Intelligence Community; Air Force, Pentagon, Defense Security Service, USSTRATCOM, NSA, and NGA • 8.5 yrs managing finance & contracts for DoD & US Air Force • 6+ yrs as PM of Air Force cyber programs. • 5+ yrs supervising civilian and union employees as functional manager • 3+ yrs in formal acquisition. Led source selection, contract awards. • 2+ yrs as a systems integrator, supporting NGA systems • 5+ yrs supporting Federal sales teams with proposal development, buisness cases analysis, new business pipeline development, capture management, and solution architecture: 14 pursuits/proposals supported at Lockheed Martin. 20 proposals supported at CSC. Contributed to multiple winning bids. • Effective communicator! Briefed key stakeholders, senior execs, general officers. • Promoted innovation by leading several Air Force cyber pilot projects; Radio over IP at Offutt AFB, AF Portal at Bolling AFB • Expert in DoD cyberspace defense operations – experienced leading cyber defense operations for 2 Air Force network enclaves. o Prior Designated Approval Authority Rep (DAAR), led certification & accreditation activities across 2 bases– 45 total systems • Former Air Force Major in cyber operations career field. • CSC Distinguished Architect Specialties: Active TS Security Clearances. summary: • 16 yrs in cyber career field: systems engineering, strategic planning, IT services mgt, communications & acquisition within the C2 and C4ISR domains • 13 yrs as 1st & 2nd line leader; mentoring, coaching, guiding, directing, military, civilian, & contractor teams of various sizes. • 12 yrs in DOD and Intelligence Community; Air Force, Pentagon, Defense Security Service, USSTRATCOM, NSA, and NGA • 8.5 yrs managing finance & contracts for DoD & US Air Force • 6+ yrs as PM of Air Force cyber programs. • 5+ yrs supervising civilian and union employees as functional manager • 3+ yrs in formal acquisition. Led source selection, contract awards. • 2+ yrs as a systems integrator, supporting NGA systems • 5+ yrs supporting Federal sales teams with proposal development, buisness cases analysis, new business pipeline development, capture management, and solution architecture: 14 pursuits/proposals supported at Lockheed Martin. 20 proposals supported at CSC. Contributed to multiple winning bids. • Effective communicator! Briefed key stakeholders, senior execs, general officers. • Promoted innovation by leading several Air Force cyber pilot projects; Radio over IP at Offutt AFB, AF Portal at Bolling AFB • Expert in DoD cyberspace defense operations – experienced leading cyber defense operations for 2 Air Force network enclaves. o Prior Designated Approval Authority Rep (DAAR), led certification & accreditation activities across 2 bases– 45 total systems • Former Air Force Major in cyber operations career field. • CSC Distinguished Architect Specialties: Active TS Security Clearances. Cyber Security Domain Expert, Capture Management, Business Development, Program Management, Customer Relations Planning, Information Assurance, Strategic Planning, Emergency Response Management, FISMA Compliance, Privacy Act Compliance, Test and Acquisition, Hiring Management and Staffing

summary: • 16 yrs in cyber career field: systems engineering, strategic planning, IT services mgt, communications & acquisition within the C2 and C4ISR domains • 13 yrs as 1st & 2nd line leader; mentoring, coaching, guiding, directing, military, civilian, & contractor teams of various sizes. • 12 yrs in DOD and Intelligence Community; Air Force, Pentagon, Defense Security Service, USSTRATCOM, NSA, and NGA • 8.5 yrs managing finance & contracts for DoD & US Air Force • 6+ yrs as PM of Air Force cyber programs. • 5+ yrs supervising civilian and union employees as functional manager • 3+ yrs in formal acquisition. Led source selection, contract awards. • 2+ yrs as a systems integrator, supporting NGA systems • 5+ yrs supporting Federal sales teams with proposal development, buisness cases analysis, new business pipeline development, capture management, and solution architecture: 14 pursuits/proposals supported at Lockheed Martin. 20 proposals supported at CSC. Contributed to multiple winning bids. • Effective communicator! Briefed key stakeholders, senior execs, general officers. • Promoted innovation by leading several Air Force cyber pilot projects; Radio over IP at Offutt AFB, AF Portal at Bolling AFB • Expert in DoD cyberspace defense operations – experienced leading cyber defense operations for 2 Air Force network enclaves. o Prior Designated Approval Authority Rep (DAAR), led certification & accreditation activities across 2 bases– 45 total systems • Former Air Force Major in cyber operations career field. • CSC Distinguished Architect Specialties: Active TS Security Clearances. title: Senior Program Manager
description: Lead a $50 million full lifecycle, agile software development and delivery program. The effort includes development, integration, testing, deployment, training, information system security, and maintenance. The program implements the modernization, migration and transition of a mission management system for 3 operating locations including 2 international. Software written in Java on virtualized Linux/OS mission environment. Responsible for cost, planning, and technical performance. Conduct executive-level client and senior executive management communication and interface. Successfully captured on-contract-growth of over $200M. During this assignment, led the successful Red Program Recovery which resulted in a 100% Award Fee score from our customer. summary: Presently, reporting to the Director of Special Programs within the Space Ground Solutions Line of Business, under IS&GS Defense & Intelligence Solutions, as Senior Program Manager. Established ability to quickly learn the intricacies of diverse lines of business and make immediate revenue and margin impacts. Led high performing team selected for highest award in the Corporation. title: Senior Program Manager
description: Led a $65 million per year critical infrastructure Facilities, Security and Logistics Services program. The enterprise program provided facilities support (facilities maintenance, design & construction, security, logistics, warehousing, ESH, property control, protocol, document control, procurement & custodial) in 2 geographic locations including international. Responsible for the cost, schedule, and technical performance of a 260+ person program. Led the program to a successful capture, transition and execution of a new contract in 2007. Program received progressively higher award fee scores during my assignment culminating in back to back 100% Award Fee scores in my last two periods as the program manager. The FSLS program won the 2008 NOVA Team Award. Developed and enhanced effective relationships with customers, subcontractors, suppliers and other stakeholders critical to the success of the program. Elevated and sustained the business acumen of the program leadership team through sustained and continuous learning. Developed an Award Fee management tool which resulted improved Award Fee scores from an initial of 85% to a final of 100%.

title: Program Manager
description: Led a $16 million per year professional/technical services contract including work allocation among senior managers, provide guidance and advice, analysis and development of financial data, staff assignments, and budgeting. I had full responsibility for program success to achieve Sales, Profit and Awards goals, ensure that the client's requirements are met and that all provisions of the contract are satisfied. Manage an organization of over 100 hardware technicians, operations analyst, and software engineers supporting 8 operational field sites including 1 international location. The systems include SGI and SUN workstations and servers, C/C++ based applications, and ORACLE and SYBASE RDBMS. Coordinate and communicate with Air Force senior management, and promote the Lockheed Martin team's capabilities, responsiveness, and concern for the program success.

summary: Presently, reporting to the Director of Special Programs within the Space Ground Solutions Line of Business, under IS&GS Defense & Intelligence Solutions, as Senior Program Manager. Responsible for directing a program portfolio providing Mission Management IT solutions to the Federal Government across multiple CONUS and OCONUS locations. Innovative business and technology leader with over 27 years of progressive experience in aligning technology solutions with business strategies of public, global companies. Established ability to quickly learn the intricacies of diverse lines of business and make immediate revenue and margin impacts. Visionary able to develop and execute business strategy delivered via innovative, technology solutions. Experience leading 200-300 person engineering and software applications functions through high growth, flawless execution, and recovery scenarios. Talented at building high performance organizations within a multi-cultural, globally distributed work force. Proven track record of managing operating costs; successful, global software application deployments; and creating new multi-million dollar revenue opportunities. Demonstrated leadership style that leverages metrics, performance-based goals and shared purpose to inspire and develop employees. Led high performing team selected for highest award in the Corporation. Specialties • Program Execution & Delivery • Strategic Planning & Management • Global Enterprise Deployment and Execution • Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) • Management of Diverse, Multicultural Teams • Stakeholder Management • Globally Distributed Operational Locations • Delivery of Engineering and Technology Services • Virtualized Development and Operations • Large-Scale IT System Development

title: Lead Software Architect
description: Assigned as a Lead Software Architect for the Utility Cloud Manager (UCM). The UCM is a web application that manages virtual machines and cloud environments. Created detailed design of the UCM as a Spring MVC application. Views are JSPs with data transfer being both classic Java beans and XML. View dynamics are integrated with JQuery and CSS. Integrated the UCM VmWare vCloud provisioner and Smart Cloud provisioners. Designing and developing the backend data store using MySQL and Hibernate as a data access technology. Using the Hibernate Template and annotations for table to object mappings. Designed and implemented a Spring RESTful Web Service to query a Perl process on the VM Ware statistics. Designing and implementing a Spring RESTful Web Service to integrate with SmartCloud cloud management software. Designing and implementing the User Authentication using PKI and CASPORT.

title: Lead software engineer
description: assigned to a Texeltek/ClearEdge contract to work in custom analytics. Responsibilities included the following: Designed and developed a software abstraction layer in Java between custom analytics and Hadoop map/reduce (M/R) framework. Various analytics use abstraction layer. Designing custom analytics using the abstraction layer and M/R framework to generate Question Focused-Data (QFD) from large volumes of unstructured data; data was stored in the Cloud (GhostMachine environment). Designed and developed a data abstraction layer between proprietary data formats and custom analytics. Developed various analytics using the Pig scripting language. Developed UDFs for loading and storing data. Developed an Oracle binary object output formatter. Formatter parses files stored on Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS), regular Unix, and Windows platforms. Java Velocity templates are used for output formatting and development was done in Eclipse and Maven. Source code repository was SVN. Fix various web services (Servlet and Flex GUIs) that connect to the cloud to interface to custom analytic output. Developing software using the Agile software development process; weekly sprints, daily scrums and weekly sprint planning sessions.

title: Lead Software Engineer
description: Worked as a subcontractor for the 2010 Census. Primary responsibilities included the following: Provided software development and support for the Paper IPT by writing C# code for the paper sorter, scanner, and collator. The monitor adds and queries data from multiple data sources including PerfMon, an XML database, an Oracle and a SQL Server database. The monitor displays data using a 3rd party graphing tool, Nevron Charts. Charts are dynamically created and updated using a background thread. The chart and it's data can be exported to Excel and copied to the clipboard. The reporter is an abstraction layer built on top of logging and data repositories. It is configuration controlled and the reporting components have no idea of which physical repositories are being used. Enhanced a software patch builder and build wizard written in C# that interfaces to Rational Clearcase and Clearquest.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Projects and primary responsibilities included the following: Designed, implemented and tested a message abstraction in C# for messages between the core operational software and the simulation software. Designed, implemented and tested a GPS/INS simulator in C++. GPS/INS simulator accepts ground truth from the vehicle dynamics and computes the eTalin to send to the core operational software. Designed, implemented and tested a simulation process manager in C# .NET to assist testers with the launching of the operational and simulation software. As a Systems/Software Engineer in Unmanned Air Systems, responsibilities included the following: Wrote a C# .NET application that managed unmanned air vehicles (RMAX helicopter) and unmanned ground vehicles (UGVs). Program supported both GDRS's ground based planner and Perceptek's air based planner. Enabled message passing between the SMI, the ground based planner and Perceptek's air planner. Integrated GDRS's SMI and eXternal Autonomous Control (XAC) with Aurora's mission software on the Organic Air Vehicle. Designed and tested the communications between the SMI and the mission software. Delivered and tested the ground control station with the vehicle. Designed, coded (C# .NET) and tested the integration between GDRS's SMI and Tybrin/Georgia Tech's Falconview application. Wrote C# .NET marshalling code that wraps Falconview C++ unmanaged code. Integrated vehicle route management, battle space object identification, targets, aircraft flight performance tables, weather data, and coordinate conversions between the two applications. Worked on the analysis, design, implementation and testing of the Weapon/Target Pairing interface for the Future Force Warrior project. The interface was an implementation of a C++ abstract messaging class that integrated with the Information Management (IM) middleware software.

title: Customer Operations
description: and reassigned to Customer Operations. In operations my responsibilities include the following: Leading the design and implementation for CDMA radios in the DIAD 4. CDMA implementation is plugged right into the sub-network layer of the protocol stack. The sub-network layer will support both CDMA and GPRS radios without knowledge of which radios are on the network. Coded a front end user interface using Visual Studio .NET and C#. The interface receives messages from the Mobile Message Switch and the DIAD. Coded, tested and integrated an embedded C++ radio loader launcher on the DIAD 4. The radio loader reads the current configuration and attempts to upgrade the loader to a new configuration. Converted the existing DIAD 3 radio loader to a DIAD 4 radio loader. The version 3 loader was written in C/C++ on the PSOS platform.

title: Customer Technology
description: my responsibilities were centered on two Web applications (Quick Cost Calculator (QCC) and Internet Shipping (UIS)). Specific accomplishments are listed belo Served as the Release Build Manager. Responsibilities included development environment support, running daily builds using a cron job (Ant task), patching software builds for maintenance releases, and component integration. Lead the design and implementation of allowing both QCC and Internet Shipping to share a user's session using Struts, Java and JSPs. This basically allowed the two applications to share data and made the site easier to use for our users. Lead the re-design efforts for the Quick Cost Calculator (QCC) in conjunction with www.ups.com site re-design. Created a schedule for QCC's redesign. The schedule spanned the entire development cycle (design, coding, testing and integration). Successfully implemented the new QCC design and the integration of the external QCC interface to the Page Generation Framework and the C-Clamp presentation layer using Struts, JSPs and Java. Mentored fellow developers on the implementation of the QCC design and the use of Model View Controller (MVC). User interaction was logged with the previously developed Reporter and Log4J. Acted as the primary interface to the Rating and Validation component (RAVE), Rating Component, Shipping Component and Internet Pickup for both QCC and IS. Performed load analysis testing using LoadRunner for QCC and the XML data provided by the reporter. XSL was used to transform the XML data into the LoadRunner tag based input. Designed, coded and tested a Reporter that collects statistics on QCC ranging from measuring time span hits to country specific queries. Framework was extended to measure real-time exceptions, servlet monitoring, and load balancing by extending Log4J. The output of the QCC reporter is in two formats, one for viewing (HTML) and one for further processing (XML).

summary: I am dynamic, dependable and an independent individual but I am also a great team member with good communication skills. I have nearly 10 years experience working for the DOD. I started as a level one help desk technician with CSC/Eagle Alliance and have worked my way up learning new skills in the technical industry. I have worked as a Systems Administrator Tier I and worked up to a Tier 2/3 as well as Software Engineer I/Technology Enabler. My skill set is stronger when it comes to communicating, customer service and working within a team environment where we can gel together and work together to accomplish something. I am a hard worker and am quick to learn. I would prefer to learn hands on rather than reading how to learn something. I'm open to new possibilities whether it be a new opportunity that I already have the skill set for or for a new opportunity where I am learning something new. If there are any questions, please feel free to contact me.

title: Help Desk Specialist/System Administrator
description: • Create and process tickets via the Remedy Action Request System (ARS) • Monitors web queue for QOS tickets • Monitor workflow of the web queue, both working and assigning task tickets • Worked within the training team to train new employees on all aspects of the help desk ( agent applications, tools etc…) • Works within a team environment to meet SLA goals • Provides telephone technical support/troubleshooting for Windows and Unix-based PCs to resolve customer software/hardware problems • Remotely connects to workstations using Systems Management Server (SMS) to install and upgrade software, fix problems within specific applications, and map network drives and/or printers • Create user and administrator accounts on various networks • Participate with the Call Center as needed, supporting approx. 50-80 calls a day depending on call volume • Would have to troubleshoot networking issues by pinging servers to make sure they were up and available, would have to create new user profiles when needed, would have to help resolve internet issues by checking the users PKI certificates etc… • Used Putty to SSH to unix servers to change users passwords and change permissions for different files • Used tracert to deternine where the connect was lost between systems

summary: Adam Shook is a Solutions Architect at ClearEdge, working with customers to solve their big data problems using a number of Hadoop and related technologies. In the past, Shook has engineered several mission-critical Hadoop applications in the U.S. Intelligence Community. He has developed and taught training courses for working professionals new to Hadoop and Pig. Shook is also an author of O'Reilly Media's "MapReduce Design Patterns", a book to help beginners and experts alike solve complex problems using MapReduce. He graduated from the University of Maryland Baltimore County in 2009 with a B.S. in Computer Science, and once again in 2013 with a Master's degree focusing on in-memory distributed systems. He occasionally teaches CS courses at UMBC.

title: Software Engineer II
description: - Developed and instructed courses on Hadoop and Pig, including architectures and APIs - Solved complex analytic problems over very large data sets using Java, Python, PigLatin, and a number of Hadoop-related technologies. Problem sets include modernizing analytics that use to be run over large-scale Oracle databases - Architected big data analytic applications by orchestrating a number of big data technologies, such as HDFS for data storage, MapReduce for batch analytics, ZooKeeper for coordination and configuration, and Accumulo for a number of metadata applications. Has been involved in design and implementation of several end-to-end big data applications for a project dealing with a large-scale production Hadoop cluster

title: Computer Scientist
description: Researched, prototyped and developed a new storage / processing cloud platform to help monitor and troubleshoot a large-scale distributed messaging fabric. Responsibilities spanned the operating system installs and configuration to the Java code being deployed. The platform included a framework for rapidly writing and deploying analytics, robust real-time query API for web users to mine their own data, real-time connected graph that can be traversed using TInkerpop's Gremlin DSL, and a domain-agnostic framework for quickly modeling and ingesting data into the cloud.

description: Worked on widgets for OWF that allowed data & knowledge collection, aggregation, and sharing using model-agnostic representations and normalization techniques. title: Intern
description: Wrote a web application for the CEO that allowed the PMs in the company to generate scenarios for determining optimal resource allocations based on burn rates. Various formats of invoices were ingested into the system and charts used to display rolling average projections based on user-­‐generated scenarios for calculating the resulting burn curves when differing resources were allocated.

title: Software Engineer
description: TS/SCI Cleared Software Engineer - Leading a team to build from the ground up and maintain a web portal consolidating all shared resources, services, datasets, documentation, etc between subcontractors within the DIA's cloud computing project called Orion. - Built upon the Intelligence Community's eChirp service, creating a more intuitive user experience complete with tools for data analysis based on live chirps from the IC. - Built a front end search portal to poll Intelink.gov for text, image, video, and map based search results via ajax. - Maintained a Java search proxy built to poll multiple search sources and endpoints using a Federated search api. - Worked on the DCGS-A UX project to create a workflow dashboard with entity graphing, editing, and file storage capabilities. - Created widgets utilizing the Ozone Widget Framework and ExtJS - Participated in building a Windows based thick client battle simulator (METIS) using WPF/.NET following a WPF/MVVM architecture - Front and back end programming experience. - UX/UI planning and implementation for windows desktop application. - Extensive use of Microsoft Expressions Blend and Visual Studio. Implementing within a Restful client/server architecture. - Much agile development environment experience

summary: Software Engineer with an eye for cutting edge interface design and experience in rapid development environments. Experience in multiple stages of development, planning, prototyping, development for production, as well as testing and software maintenance. Adaptive to fast paced environments, quick turnarounds, and new situations/architectures. Strongly suited with the ability to bridge the gap between design and implementation. I'm an engineer who's interests lie in well designed software, both in terms of User Experience and efficiently organized code. My experience has brought challenges largely dealing with the organized display of data for the purpose of searching, management, and analysis. My latest project has brought both a challenge and opportunity to lead a small team of developers, taking a content management web portal from design to production. I'm also a devoted musician and love to share my work with anyone interested. I've played piano since age 5 and continue to make use of my talent in church and in personal projects. I'm very engaged in music production. My interests also are in photography, videography, writing, and theology.

title: Senior Staff Systems Engineer
description: Lead, drive and support systems engineering efforts for various activities including Product Line Architecture, AEGIS BMD, DDG1000 and CVN77. Responsibilities and activities have included: • Translate program needs into tasks and deliverables, develop schedules, plans, and supporting processes, create milestones, support earned value management • Provide individual and team direction and guidance to meet program objectives • Present to and communicate with customers, developers, engineers • Analyze/formulate system requirements and define necessary functionality • Utilized DOORS tool for requirements management and traceability • Develop functionality, requirements, use cases, and Rhapsody model artifacts to support PEO IWS vehicle control product line architecture activities (MH-60R helo) • Lead systems engineering activities for the development of the Aircraft Control Component of the DDG1000 C2I system • Generate UML artifacts to develop and document architecture, requirements and interfaces utilizing tools such as Rationale ROSE and Rhapsody • Participate in Configuration Control Board activities • Direct and/or support development of program deliverables including Prime Item Development Specifications, Computer Program Requirements Specifications, Concept of Operation, System Engineering Management Plan, System and Component Requirements Specifications, Component Handbooks, Configuration Item Baseline Report • Information System Security Officer (ISSO) for several classified networks

title: Senior Staff Systems Engineer
description: Research and Development Center: Held various positions with various responsibilities including: • Performed system analysis of end-to-end carrier class, broadband cable access network; (GR-303 over T1 to Class 5 Switch with IP Digital Terminal for telephony/multimedia High Speed Data (HSD) (PCM DS0 to/from packets) and DOCSIS Cable Access System) • Researched/measured analog performance parameters for voice grade communication over broadband cable-access network • Performed requirements analysis/development for CDMA system components • Developed system specification driving software implementation of customer requested mobile phone features • Created requirements database (Rational RequisitePro) to drive task clarification in the development of a CDMA radio base station local element manager Consumer Products Division: Planned, developed, and coordinated verification efforts for industrialization/manufacturing of 1900 MHZ PCS and other mobile phone products. • Successfully introduced new product designs into the manufacturing process • Identified/implemented solutions to product and process issues • Utilized root cause corrective action guidelines • Provided technical assistance/direction to quality functions • Performed statistical analysis of production test data (ORACLE Discoverer 2000) • Significantly increased manufacturing first pass yields from 85% to 95% • Increased production line throughput by reducing product test time Private Radio Systems Division: Planned, developed, and coordinated system test activities for various components of advanced two-way voice/data trunked radio communication systems (EDACS). • Verified land mobile radio system digital data transmission capabilities using Radio Data Interface (RDI) protocol over RS-232 and Internet Protocol (IP) over Ethernet via proprietary data gateway • Generated requirements for automated test equipment development • Analyzed operational issues at customer site, recommended solutions

title: Senior Systems Engineer
description: Developed system design concepts and requirements for military radar and sonar programs. Allocated requirements to software and hardware components. Developed and maintained detailed technical documentation including requirements specifications and system operational tutorials. Developed integration and system verification test plans, procedures and reports. Performed system configuration and parameter sensitivity studies. Interfaced with customer. Supported proposal activities. • Lead systems engineer for the development of a land-based sonar system signal and data processing unit • Led systems engineering effort to replace aging radar consoles with COTS workstations/PCs • Designed Man/Machine interface and operational requirements for a major sonar system upgrade consisting of a fiber-optic network and reassignable resources (SRQ-19, ECP-51) • Coordinated system integration test of multi-computer surface ship sonar/combat systems • Performed RF coverage assessment for phased array radar systems (FPS-117) • Generated technical input to proposal efforts, resulting in significant wins • Researched and developed programs for radar/sonar simulation and performance evaluation • Developed test and diagnostic software for a five board image processor satellite subsystem • Redesigned a custom memory bus interface card for a proprietary digital data processor • Performed technical evaluations, identified deficiencies, and initiated corrective actions • Presented at customer briefings and technical discussions • Developed software for analysis of algorithm performance and system sensitivity studies

title: Lead Systems Engineer / System Architect, Ship Systems Automation
description: Responsible for leading systems engineering efforts and development of system architecture for FREEDOM class Littoral Combat Ship machinery control system. Provide technical direction and decision making regarding overall system architecture, requirements and design. Work closely with Business Development to align technology goals with market needs and to identify and develop capture opportunities as well as support capture efforts and competitive proposal in various leadership roles.

summary: Matt Stites has over 13 years of software and systems engineering experience spanning both the commercial and defense industries including domestic and foreign naval ship programs, naval combat systems, nuclear and green energy technology, and research and development (R&D). Matt has held a technical engineering leadership role for more than six years at Lockheed Martin with focus and experience in the systems engineering and architecture of digital control systems. Specialties / Technology Interests: Systems Engineering, System Architecture, Control Systems, Energy Systems, Naval Combat Systems, Requirements Engineering, Requirements Analysis, System Architecture Patterns, Automated Systems, Systems Engineering Workflow and Management, Cyber-Physical Systems, Model-based Systems Engineering (MBSE), Engineering Project Management.

title: Principle Investigator, Research and Development
description: Responsible for increasing the technology readiness level (TRL) of research and development projects in order to prepare for the transition to production and to increase business growth through new product development. Managed R&D activities to achieve successful completion of technology plans and goals. Provided systems level team vision and direction for the product line and led an interdisciplinary team of six engineers in the development of a software intensive system. Managed planning, earned value, risk and opportunity, staffing and day-to-day control account management activities for R&D projects with multimillion dollar budgets. Worked closely with Business Development to align technology goals with market needs and to identify and develop capture opportunities as well as support capture efforts in various leadership roles.

title: Lead Systems Engineer, MK41 Vertical Launching System, Domestic and International Programs
description: Responsible for transforming customer needs, expectations, and constraints into product solutions and supporting these solutions throughout the product life cycle. Technical point of contact for European/Australian Vertical Launching System (VLS) Foreign Military Sales (FMS) programs and domestic US Navy MK 41 VLS programs. Responsible for the development, submission, and tracking of Nomenclature Assignment Requests (NARs), Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs), Ship Change Documents (SCDs), technical white papers, trade studies, technical action item responses, and presentations to the MK 41 VLS customer. Provided review and concurrence on technical documentation and information provided to the customer. Control Account Manager for the systems engineering efforts of the European/Australian and US Navy programs and supported program level earned value management. Led and support rough order of magnitude (ROM) estimates in response to customer requests. Coordinated ROM estimates with integrated product teams (IPT) and program leads to prepare basis of estimates (BOE), and developed final cost estimates.

title: Systems Engineer, Combat System Requirements and Integration
description: Supported multiple international programs involving nations such as Norway, Germany, Japan, Australia, and Turkey. Worked closely with US Navy and Australian customers in leading the execution of two successful system integration test events. Received a Special Recognition Award for Team Excellence for involvement in the Japanese Modular Production integration testing, failure investigation and resolution. Combat Systems Requirements and Integration engineer for the Standard Missile-3 new missile integration and Aegis BMD Block 04 efforts to develop and maintain various internal and external communication interfaces. Worked with Lockheed Martin teammates to achieve 100% Award Fee for the Aegis Ballistic Missile Defense Block 04 (3.0) program in 2004. Presented technical content and status to external community and customer at the Aegis BMD Block 04 (3.1) Critical Item Specification Review and the Preliminary Design Review.

title: Senior Engineer
description: Responsible for the design, analysis, and implementation of flight control laws for a 200 lb. remotely piloted rotorcraft to support autonomous rotorcraft research. • Implemented a hover/forward flight way point following control law with automatic take-off and landing capability. Designed the topology for the control law and performed analysis and simulation to validate concept and select control law gains. Coded the design on the flight computer taking the code through unit testing, system level testing, and pre-flight test rehearsals with the operational team. Flight tested the design and iterated the control gains to achieve acceptable tracking performance and actuator activity. • Designed and programmed ground station applications to manage flight operation of the autonomous rotorcraft. Implemented user interfaces to send command, display telemetry, plot real-time strip-charts, and record data. • Supported integration of various autonomous research systems with the automatic control system. These included a reactive planner executive, a landing determination system using stereo vision and LADAR, and an obstacle avoidance system.

title: Senior Engineer
description: Developed software for real-time spacecraft simulators, a spacecraft closed-loop ground controller, and the client side of a telemetry and command database system. Involved in all aspects of system development and delivery including customer design reviews, coding, integration testing, version control, customer witnessed qualification testing, installation, customer training, and documentation. • Designed, analyzed, and coded a fuel-efficient thruster algorithm for use in a ground based system for real-time control of a satellite. The ground controller received telemetry down from the spacecraft and sent thruster and magnetic torquer commands up to the spacecraft. Ground control system was engaged and controlled the satellite for ten months. • Responsible for the testing, version control, and final release of a real-time, PC based, spacecraft simulator. Responsible for the development, integration, and modification of various software components of the simulator. This includes the network interfaces to the ground station, the real-time models, the real-time scheduler, and the interface to the spacecraft ported flight firmware. Worked closely with firmware engineer in coordinating interface development and testing of ported firmware. • Developed simulator user interfaces for display of telemetry, scenario management, spacecraft command queuing, logging, help pages, and simulation control. Wrote utilities for simulator commanding, simulation scenario initialization, and telemetry processing. Developed a rigid body constrained motion deployment model using a recursive tree algorithm to simulated solar array and reflector deployment dynamics. • Developed a client side application to retrieve and store spacecraft telemetry and command data on an ORACLE database server. This client was part of a larger system to manage customer, and company wide distributions of the spacecraft engineering databases.

title: Staff Engineer
description: Involved in multiple projects in fields of space propulsion, thermal control and related technologies. • Lead cost reduction studies of the propulsion system for a major military satellite program. Investigated available and near term technology alternatives to meet challenging performance requirements. Presented final report and recommendation to program management and the customer that identifed a viable lower cost solution for future technology insertion. • Developed specification and design of a new electronic pressure regulation system. Managed budget, schedule, and provided technical direction to design engineers and subcontractors. • Qualified an advanced rocket engine for a new application. Developed technical requirements and contract statement of work. Managed supplier activities to demonstrate capability to meet long life mission requirements. Reviewed all design analyses, test results, and anomalies. • Developed computer simulation of a fluid system for an advanced early warning missile detection system. Modeled gas thermodynamics, heat transfer, hydraulic pressure losses and thruster performance to study baseline operational scenarios and impacts of design alternatives. • Participated in 24/7 real-time mission operations during launch and initial maneuvers of a large space science observatory. Developed software for database queries and analysis of spacecraft telemetry data to assess system performance and health.

title: VO&E Deputy Program Manager
description: • VO&E Deputy - Responsible for oversight/insight of the Vehicle Operation and Engineering Organization (VO&E) to include Contracts, Subcontracts Interface to the customer and new business development. This responsibility includes day-to-day interface with the customer concerning mission success, operational budgets and schedules • Proposal Manager – Responsible for leading the development and costing of all Denver and Sunnyvale proposal submittals including new capabilities and contract extensions. • Cost Control Manger – Cost manager overseeing all VO&E’s budgets to 5% swing rate, responsibilities include budget spread, monthly accounting and deviation reporting for $250 dollars contracts. • Program Business Development – Responsible for leading new enhancements and recapitalization projects as well as coordinating and briefings Program information to VIP customers to ensure improved customer relationships. • Subcontract Manager – Responsible for overseeing all VO&E (Denver and Sunnyvale) subcontractor totaling $75M/year • IKONOS - Responsible for the execution of the IKONOS project responsibilities include the development of enhanced Flight Software and the recapitalization of the IKONOS simulator. • Transition Manager – Responsible for the transition of an Operational site in California to New Mexico responsibilities included testing of new ground system, training of new operational and engineering staff.

description: • Readiness Program Lead – Responsible for ensuring the readiness of the ground system, flight hardware and operational crew for a multi-billion dollar project. • Performance Assessment and Evaluation (PE&A) Lead - Responsible for the assessment of the on-orbit performance of the flight hardware including the development of the performance metrics, development and negotiation of the Performance contract and lead of engineers responsible for the monthly collection/adjudication of metric data. • External Interface Lead – Factory representative to the external customers for the resolution of discrepancies, impact assessment, cost and implementation of system changes. • Request For Change / Discrepancy (RFC/DR) Lead – Responsible for the administration of the DR database including the timely and accurate resolution of discrepancies written on factory-produced hardware, software and databases. This activity includes refining current processes to take advantage of practices that are more efficient and procedures.

title: Financial Analyst
description: - Financial Analyst for Bell commercial aircraft, focusing on Asia, North America, budgets, and commissions. - Compile monthly and quarterly reports showing commercial aircraft backlog and revenue. - Evaluate Independent Representative, Customer Service Facility, and Consultant financial statements and perform financial risk assessments using qualitative and quantitative data and analysis techniques. - Responsible for generating and compiling monthly reports for a comprehensive metrics package providing performance analysis on financial measures including Bookings, Sales, and Cash by model and region. - Regional sales support for order, cash, sales, and budgeting versus prior forecast, AOP, and stretch goal with appropriate variance analysis and qualitative risk assessments.

title: Associate Cost/Schedule Analyst
description: Financial analysis on the V-22 program with an emphasis in Earned Value Management for Support Equipment, ILS, and Field Service Support groups. • Identify data/project anomalies and provide analysis to project leads to help mitigate and explain project conditions. • Manage contractual items such as funding, notifications, period of performance. • Ensure integration and synchronization of cost and schedule EVM data. • Generate, analyze, and report month Earned Value (EV) data. • Monitor project EACs for validity and accuracy. • Provide labor, material, and relocation analysis through SAP. • Provide status for management through Primavera Project Manager (PPM) • Prepare variance analysis reports.
