education: [{"name"=>"The Johns Hopkins University", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1985 – 1988"}, {"name"=>"The Citadel", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1979 – 1983"}]
summary: Mr. Ring has over 30 years of Senior Technical and Program Management Leadership experience within the intelligence Community. Mr. Ring joined BCT in December 2011 as the Vice President of System Engineering and Technical Assistance (SETA) Programs and in December of 2014 was elevated to BCT Chief Operations Officer. As COO Mr. Ring is responsible for directing, administering, and coordinating all internal operational activities of the organization. Mr. Ring also continues to directly support multiple Agency Mission Customers as a Project Manager/System Engineer. In the Project Management role, Mr. Ring is responsible to the government contracting officer and division/branch chiefs for successful program cost, schedule, and performance. In the System Engineering role, Mr. Ring provides system engineering life cycle management support (requirements analysis, system design, development, risk management, test, and deployment), assists in the creation of technical documents (SRDs, CONOPs, and System Test Plans), provides technical leadership, and is ultimately responsible for the technical integrity of work performed and deliverables associated with the system engineering area. Prior to coming to BCT, Mr. Ring worked for General Dynamics, Advanced Information Systems for over 25 years, starting as a software engineer and quickly elevating to Senior Systems Engineering and Technical Management positions. While with General Dynamics, Mr. Ring was an Intelligence Systems Line of Business Sr. Engineering Manager, responsible for 1/3 of the engineering organization aligned to regional Business Groups. Mr. Ring is INCOSE CSEP certified, Project Management Institute PMP certified, a Certified SCRUM Master, holds a BS degree in Computer Science from the Citadel and a Masters of Science degree in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University. He has also taken several business management courses at the Darden Graduate School of Business, University of Virginia.

Mr. Ring is INCOSE CSEP certified, Project Management Institute PMP certified, a Certified SCRUM Master, holds a BS degree in Computer Science from the Citadel and a Masters of Science degree in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University. He has also taken several business management courses at the Darden Graduate School of Business, University of Virginia.

summary: Mr. Ring has over 30 years of Senior Technical and Program Management Leadership experience within the intelligence Community. Mr. Ring joined BCT in December 2011 as the Vice President of System Engineering and Technical Assistance (SETA) Programs and in December of 2014 was elevated to BCT Chief Operations Officer. As COO Mr. Ring is responsible for directing, administering, and coordinating all internal operational activities of the organization. Mr. Ring also continues to directly support multiple Agency Mission Customers as a Project Manager/System Engineer. In the Project Management role, Mr. Ring is responsible to the government contracting officer and division/branch chiefs for successful program cost, schedule, and performance. In the System Engineering role, Mr. Ring provides system engineering life cycle management support (requirements analysis, system design, development, risk management, test, and deployment), assists in the creation of technical documents (SRDs, CONOPs, and System Test Plans), provides technical leadership, and is ultimately responsible for the technical integrity of work performed and deliverables associated with the system engineering area. Prior to coming to BCT, Mr. Ring worked for General Dynamics, Advanced Information Systems for over 25 years, starting as a software engineer and quickly elevating to Senior Systems Engineering and Technical Management positions. While with General Dynamics, Mr. Ring was an Intelligence Systems Line of Business Sr. Engineering Manager, responsible for 1/3 of the engineering organization aligned to regional Business Groups. Mr. Ring is INCOSE CSEP certified, Project Management Institute PMP certified, a Certified SCRUM Master, holds a BS degree in Computer Science from the Citadel and a Masters of Science degree in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University. He has also taken several business management courses at the Darden Graduate School of Business, University of Virginia.

title: Materials & Processes Engineering
company: ULA - United Launch Alliance - Lockheed Martin & Boeing
description: - Provide technical and design support for nonmetallic/composite manufacturing processes and material parameters used in the Atlas and Delta rocket structure and motors. - Assist customers and designers in various material selections to meet non-metallic design requirements - Develop and design test plans to qualify new parts, materials, and processes to meet launch vehicle requirements. - Conduct basic failure analysis to determine a corrective action of Parts, Materials, and Processes. - Define /review and approve requirements for parts, materials, and processes used in the manufacture of launch vehicle products. - Making changes, approve/write specifications and other documents to manage the deployment of parts, materials and processes within ULA or vendors. - Maintain the M&P Database to ensure to parts, materials, and processes meet the intended application requirements. - Project lead managing material obsolescence issues, demonstrate ability to communicate with managers, colleagues, customers, and suppliers. Effectively managed multiple projects, shift priorities, and timeline pressure to meet project deadlines.

title: Business Development
description: As Raytheon Company Intelligence, Information and Services Mission Support Solutions Business Development Manager, Jim Brooke’s primary responsibility is to identify, qualify and develop new business opportunities in support of the MSS product line. He partners with the product line leadership team and the Mission Support program managers in formulating long-range strategic plans designed to achieve growth and profit objectives, and well as consider key partnerships that complement and/or enhance the product line’s broad growth and marketing objectives. Jim's primary DOD business development focus areas are: • Surveillance systems • Radar/sensor/command and control solutions • Operations, maintenance and sustainment • Tactical and T&E ground and aviation ranges • Tactical communications • Logistics and training. Jim has more than 18 years of professional experience in business development, operations management, marketing, and delivery of innovative, complex services and solutions for the Department of Defense, civil agencies, and international customers. He was responsible for establishing and successfully operating regional operations for ARINC, EADS North America and BAE Systems in Colorado Springs, CO. In these roles, Jim developed business plans, identified and qualified new national and international business opportunities, led the pursuit efforts, and profitably operated the business. Jim is Past President of The Lewis and Clark Trail Heritage Foundation (www.lewisandclark.org) as well as Founding Board Member and Fundraising Chairman for the USS Midway Museum (www.midway.org). Jim served over 20 years of active duty in the U.S. Navy in a variety of carrier aviation assignments including squadron Commanding Officer and Air Wing Strike Leader. He also served in the Pentagon as Special Assistant to the Director, Navy Program Planning.

title: Vice President Client Services
description: GovernmentCIO is a Service Disabled Veteran Owned (SDVOSB) company headquartered in Washington, D.C. GovernmentCIO started its consulting work at the Department of Labor and has grown ever since to successfully perform more than 25 engagements to date. GovernmentCIO is founded on the principles of delivering excellence and always putting the client’s needs first. When you engage with GovernmentCIO you can expect to work with the best and the brightest to provide you with your desired outcome. GovernmentCIO is a rapidly growing brand that aligns its broad ranging expertise in technology and business to aid public sector leaders in confronting the challenges they face. The GovernmentCIO teams—consisting of industry, military, and government veterans—employ their skills in management and systems to close the gaps in process, communication, productivity and security.

education: [{"name"=>"Japanese Ministry of Defense, National Institute for Defense Studies", "description"=>"", "period"=>"2007 – 2008"}, {"name"=>"Japan Maritime Self Defense Force Command and Staff College", "description"=>"", "period"=>"2001 – 2002"}, {"name"=>"Defense Language Institute-Japanese", "description"=>"", "period"=>"2000 – 2001"}, {"name"=>"Naval Postgraduate School", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1994 – 1996"}, {"name"=>"United States Naval Academy", "description"=>"", "period"=>"1984 – 1988"}, {"name"=>"Ukiah", "description"=>"", "period"=>""}]
summary: Accomplished 25 year military career with more than 19 years of challenging senior leadership positions as a senior Surface Warfare Officer and Navy Foreign Area Officer in Asia. Senior PACOM Foreign Area Officer with six tours in Japan and India; unique firsthand expertise with foreign defense procurement, requirements development, budgeting, decision making, industrial/military capabilities and technology transfer/technology release requirements. Extensive experience with foreign forces, associated Japanese and Indian Ministries of Defense, Government offices related to defense systems/ technology development and defense finance. Years of successful experiences working with a diverse population in the Navy and various organizations in Japan and India have enabled me to develop as a strong leader and sharpen my skills in international negotiation, problem-solving, mentoring, conflict management and communications skills. Responsible for execution of U.S. Defense/PACOM policies through Security Cooperation/Assistance, promoting U.S. defense sales/acquisition, inter-agency coordination, and technology transfer. Unique skill-sets encompass: -National level strategic policy development -Asian cultural, social and military dynamics -U.S. Defense Organization, Systems and Policies -Capital Expenditure and Project Management -Strategic Plans Development and Implementation -Foreign Military Sales and Export Requirements -Training and Team Building Leadership Development -Individual and Organizational Development -International Engagement and Negotiation

title: Chief
description: -Advises the US Ambassador, PACOM, Department of Defense, Department of State, Department of Commerce on all matters regarding India's military and defense industries to include Foreign Military Sales, Direct Commercial Sales, Indian Defense Procurement Procedures (DPP), Defense Research Development Organization (DRDO), Indian Defense Public Sector Undertakings (DPSUs), and Industrial R&D. -Coordinates working relations with senior US Government and Government of India Defense officials -Facilitates in-country coordination for US Government scientific research and development efforts with the Indian MoD Defense Research and Development Organization

summary: Accomplished 25 year military career with more than 19 years of challenging senior leadership positions as a senior Surface Warfare Officer and Navy Foreign Area Officer in Asia. Senior PACOM Foreign Area Officer with six tours in Japan and India; unique firsthand expertise with foreign defense procurement, requirements development, budgeting, decision making, industrial/military capabilities and technology transfer/technology release requirements. Extensive experience with foreign forces, associated Japanese and Indian Ministries of Defense, Government offices related to defense systems/ technology development and defense finance. Years of successful experiences working with a diverse population in the Navy and various organizations in Japan and India have enabled me to develop as a strong leader and sharpen my skills in international negotiation, problem-solving, mentoring, conflict management and communications skills. Responsible for execution of U.S. Defense/PACOM policies through Security Cooperation/Assistance, promoting U.S. defense sales/acquisition, inter-agency coordination, and technology transfer. Unique skill-sets encompass: -National level strategic policy development -Asian cultural, social and military dynamics -U.S. Defense Organization, Systems and Policies -Capital Expenditure and Project Management -Strategic Plans Development and Implementation -Foreign Military Sales and Export Requirements -Training and Team Building Leadership Development -Individual and Organizational Development -International Engagement and Negotiation

title: Director, Navy Surface Programs
company: Mutual Defense Assistance Office, US Embassy, Tokyo
description: -Actively developed critical contacts, unparalleled access and an insider's understanding of Japan's Ministry of Defense. -Vigorously managed one of the largest country defense portfolios (274 cases-$3.6B) including all aspects of Japanese BMD/defense systems (SM-3, Aegis Upgrades, JADGE, Intermediate Level (missile) Maintenance Facility, and SM-3 Cooperative Development-SCD, and training) -Mutual Defense Assistance Office lead during the Tsunami/Fukushima reactor disaster-facilitated critical interagency coordination among US agencies (DoD, DoS, DoE, DoC, USFJ, USAID, NRC, DTRA and Naval Reactors) and Japanese counterpart organizations (Prime Minister's office, Diet, MoD, MOFA, METI, MEXT, TEPCO and industry)

summary: Accomplished 25 year military career with more than 19 years of challenging senior leadership positions as a senior Surface Warfare Officer and Navy Foreign Area Officer in Asia. Senior PACOM Foreign Area Officer with six tours in Japan and India; unique firsthand expertise with foreign defense procurement, requirements development, budgeting, decision making, industrial/military capabilities and technology transfer/technology release requirements. Extensive experience with foreign forces, associated Japanese and Indian Ministries of Defense, Government offices related to defense systems/ technology development and defense finance. Years of successful experiences working with a diverse population in the Navy and various organizations in Japan and India have enabled me to develop as a strong leader and sharpen my skills in international negotiation, problem-solving, mentoring, conflict management and communications skills. Responsible for execution of U.S. Defense/PACOM policies through Security Cooperation/Assistance, promoting U.S. defense sales/acquisition, inter-agency coordination, and technology transfer. Unique skill-sets encompass: -National level strategic policy development -Asian cultural, social and military dynamics -U.S. Defense Organization, Systems and Policies -Capital Expenditure and Project Management -Strategic Plans Development and Implementation -Foreign Military Sales and Export Requirements -Training and Team Building Leadership Development -Individual and Organizational Development -International Engagement and Negotiation

summary: Accomplished 25 year military career with more than 19 years of challenging senior leadership positions as a senior Surface Warfare Officer and Navy Foreign Area Officer in Asia. Senior PACOM Foreign Area Officer with six tours in Japan and India; unique firsthand expertise with foreign defense procurement, requirements development, budgeting, decision making, industrial/military capabilities and technology transfer/technology release requirements. Extensive experience with foreign forces, associated Japanese and Indian Ministries of Defense, Government offices related to defense systems/ technology development and defense finance. Years of successful experiences working with a diverse population in the Navy and various organizations in Japan and India have enabled me to develop as a strong leader and sharpen my skills in international negotiation, problem-solving, mentoring, conflict management and communications skills. Responsible for execution of U.S. Defense/PACOM policies through Security Cooperation/Assistance, promoting U.S. defense sales/acquisition, inter-agency coordination, and technology transfer. Unique skill-sets encompass: -National level strategic policy development -Asian cultural, social and military dynamics -U.S. Defense Organization, Systems and Policies -Capital Expenditure and Project Management -Strategic Plans Development and Implementation -Foreign Military Sales and Export Requirements -Training and Team Building Leadership Development -Individual and Organizational Development -International Engagement and Negotiation

summary: Prior to co-founding Analyze, Ms Doyle worked for 30 years with a fortune 100, top US defense contractor. She began her career as a software engineer developing software for classified DoD and intelligence customers. Later, she was program manager for a number of federal and international contracts for unmanned systems, SIGINT and international technical development programs. During this time Beth achieved certification as a six-sigma black belt and brings expert facilitation experience gained from leading company and customer teams in complex improvement projects. Over the past decade, Ms. Doyle led strategy and business development activities within the DoD and intelligence community, focusing last four years on establishing a new multi-million dollar advanced cybersecurity training business for the company. Ms. Doyle received her BA degree in French from the State University of New York with study in Neuchatel, Switzerland. Areas of expertise include: Strategic Planning Marketing Analysis Business Development Program Management Six Sigma Black Belt Certification SW Engineering Team Facilitation French, Spanish

title: Corporate IDIQ Council Business Lead
description: Served as RTSC BD Lead representative on the Raytheon Corporate IDIQ Council. Externally, coordinated all RTSC IDIQ matters with the council. Internally, I led the development of IDIQ training and awareness materials, workshops, briefings. This included working directly with HR, Supply Chain, Contracts, BD, Program / Product Lines to educate them on the use of these vehicles for growth from numerous places in our business. Led development and deployment or rapid response model for task orders. "Change Agent"

summary: Prior to co-founding Analyze, Ms Doyle worked for 30 years with a fortune 100, top US defense contractor. She began her career as a software engineer developing software for classified DoD and intelligence customers. Later, she was program manager for a number of federal and international contracts for unmanned systems, SIGINT and international technical development programs. During this time Beth achieved certification as a six-sigma black belt and brings expert facilitation experience gained from leading company and customer teams in complex improvement projects. Over the past decade, Ms. Doyle led strategy and business development activities within the DoD and intelligence community, focusing last four years on establishing a new multi-million dollar advanced cybersecurity training business for the company. Ms. Doyle received her BA degree in French from the State University of New York with study in Neuchatel, Switzerland. Areas of expertise include: Strategic Planning Marketing Analysis Business Development Program Management Six Sigma Black Belt Certification SW Engineering Team Facilitation French, Spanish

title: Director, Marketing Services
description: Responsible for all market research, competitive analysis, business planning, and marketing communications activities. title: Director
description: Developed and brought to market, a new product known as the FED-100 program (now known as the Federal Sources Opportunity Database). Product was PC-based and tracked major program opportunities within the Federal Information Technology marketplace. Grew the client base from zero to 60+ companies within a 24-month period. Maintained a database of more than 100 active programs with life cycle values in excess of $50M. Conducted program research; established and maintained a reference library of procurement information; compiled and published monthly newsletter; provided client telephone support; provided ad-hoc consulting services on programs and competitive intelligence.

title: Staff Assistant, Market Research
description: Responsible for management of the market research function. Supported a Business Development staff of 25. Activities included the acquisition and dissemination of all market documentation from both government and industry sources; established and maintained a marketing library; tracked key legislative/regulatory issues; conducted market studies; assembled and maintained competitive files; maintained company's bidders mailing list; coordinated all FOIA requests and maintained FOIA library; and prepared quarterly Congressional District representation reports.

summary: Experienced Creative Director, who combines strategic thinking with award-winning conceptual creative. A senior creative manager, and former business owner, with strong relationship building skills. Fosters an open dialogue between the client, creative and account management teams by adopting a collaborative approach. Works closely with the account management teams to help identify additional creative opportunities for clients as part of new business development. Manages the design team throughout the project to ensure that the client’s goals are met while producing creative that meets the highest standards for quality. Produces exceptional marketing results for corporate, government, and nonprofit clients. Versatile, forward thinking, and with excellent process management skills. Qualifications Exceptionally creative and organized leader who will: • Manage the creative team. Experienced in directing and supervising a team of creative professionals. Proven ability to manage projects from planning through execution while collaborating with client, creative and account management teams. • Improve brand consistency and impact. Highly involved in both developing strategy and creating consistent corporate brand identity and integrated communications. • Streamline processes and procedures. Will bring knowledge of best business practices to creative team to ensure smooth production and timely delivery of marketing materials. • Improve quality control. Review all creative output—from both internal and external resources—to ensure projects are consistent with brand standards and meet client’s stated goals and objectives. • Produce award-winning design. Hands on designer and illustrator whose work has been recognized by many local and national design competitions.Specialties:• Creative Direction • Brand Management • Strategic Marketing • Team Leader & Mentor • Creative Services Manager • Client Presentations • Integrated Marketing • Advertising • Corporate Collateral • Logos & Branding • Direct Mail • Illustration • Web & Interactive • Copywriting & Editing

summary: Experienced Creative Director, who combines strategic thinking with award-winning conceptual creative. A senior creative manager, and former business owner, with strong relationship building skills. Fosters an open dialogue between the client, creative and account management teams by adopting a collaborative approach. Works closely with the account management teams to help identify additional creative opportunities for clients as part of new business development. Manages the design team throughout the project to ensure that the client’s goals are met while producing creative that meets the highest standards for quality. Produces exceptional marketing results for corporate, government, and nonprofit clients. Versatile, forward thinking, and with excellent process management skills. Qualifications Exceptionally creative and organized leader who will: • Manage the creative team. Experienced in directing and supervising a team of creative professionals. Proven ability to manage projects from planning through execution while collaborating with client, creative and account management teams. • Improve brand consistency and impact. Highly involved in both developing strategy and creating consistent corporate brand identity and integrated communications. • Streamline processes and procedures. Will bring knowledge of best business practices to creative team to ensure smooth production and timely delivery of marketing materials. • Improve quality control. Review all creative output—from both internal and external resources—to ensure projects are consistent with brand standards and meet client’s stated goals and objectives. • Produce award-winning design. Hands on designer and illustrator whose work has been recognized by many local and national design competitions.Specialties:• Creative Direction • Brand Management • Strategic Marketing • Team Leader & Mentor • Creative Services Manager • Client Presentations • Integrated Marketing • Advertising • Corporate Collateral • Logos & Branding • Direct Mail • Illustration • Web & Interactive • Copywriting & Editing

title: Creative Director
description: Responsibility: Managed and directed the creative team for a top-20 ad agency in the production of print, online and multi-media materials. Project included: banners, posters, PPT template, microsite, and conference booklet.

summary: Experienced Creative Director, who combines strategic thinking with award-winning conceptual creative. A senior creative manager, and former business owner, with strong relationship building skills. Fosters an open dialogue between the client, creative and account management teams by adopting a collaborative approach. Works closely with the account management teams to help identify additional creative opportunities for clients as part of new business development. Manages the design team throughout the project to ensure that the client’s goals are met while producing creative that meets the highest standards for quality. Produces exceptional marketing results for corporate, government, and nonprofit clients. Versatile, forward thinking, and with excellent process management skills. Qualifications Exceptionally creative and organized leader who will: • Manage the creative team. Experienced in directing and supervising a team of creative professionals. Proven ability to manage projects from planning through execution while collaborating with client, creative and account management teams. • Improve brand consistency and impact. Highly involved in both developing strategy and creating consistent corporate brand identity and integrated communications. • Streamline processes and procedures. Will bring knowledge of best business practices to creative team to ensure smooth production and timely delivery of marketing materials. • Improve quality control. Review all creative output—from both internal and external resources—to ensure projects are consistent with brand standards and meet client’s stated goals and objectives. • Produce award-winning design. Hands on designer and illustrator whose work has been recognized by many local and national design competitions.Specialties:• Creative Direction • Brand Management • Strategic Marketing • Team Leader & Mentor • Creative Services Manager • Client Presentations • Integrated Marketing • Advertising • Corporate Collateral • Logos & Branding • Direct Mail • Illustration • Web & Interactive • Copywriting & Editing

Highly involved in both developing strategy and creating consistent corporate brand identity and integrated communications. • Streamline processes and procedures. Will bring knowledge of best business practices to creative team to ensure smooth production and timely delivery of marketing materials. • Improve quality control. Review all creative output—from both internal and external resources—to ensure projects are consistent with brand standards and meet client’s stated goals and objectives. • Produce award-winning design. Hands on designer and illustrator whose work has been recognized by many local and national design competitions.Specialties:• Creative Direction • Brand Management • Strategic Marketing • Team Leader & Mentor • Creative Services Manager • Client Presentations • Integrated Marketing • Advertising • Corporate Collateral • Logos & Branding • Direct Mail • Illustration • Web & Interactive • Copywriting & Editing

summary: Experienced Creative Director, who combines strategic thinking with award-winning conceptual creative. A senior creative manager, and former business owner, with strong relationship building skills. Fosters an open dialogue between the client, creative and account management teams by adopting a collaborative approach. Works closely with the account management teams to help identify additional creative opportunities for clients as part of new business development. Manages the design team throughout the project to ensure that the client’s goals are met while producing creative that meets the highest standards for quality. Produces exceptional marketing results for corporate, government, and nonprofit clients. Versatile, forward thinking, and with excellent process management skills. summary: Business Development Lead and Capture Management for IT Professional Services engagement with Air Force accounts. title: Director, National Cyber Security Division (NCSD)
description: Provide executive leadership in coordinating a national defense against Internet-based attacks in cooperation with public and private sectors. Provide leadership and direction to insure the efficient execution of all functional programs to fulfill the NCSD mission and objectives of enabling national, international, state, local and private sector to deter, prepare, and respond to cyber events. Grew the organization from 30 federal staff and minimal contractors to over 300 federal staff and over 600 contractors within three years. Continue to grow the workforce to double current levels within two years. Recognizing and fostering the implementation of constructive change within the workplace to support this rapid growth and expanding mission responsibilities. Responsible for the billion dollar NCSD budget. Utilize program management techniques in measuring and managing budget and costs related to the NCSD mission and their delivery. Ensure efficient, cost-effective management and use of personnel and property resources to deliver services, and ensure overall customer satisfaction. Frequent interaction with senior executives from the White House, the National Security Staff, all Federal Government agencies, including, OMB, DOD and the Intelligence Community to provide robust Information Sharing and Situational Awareness on cyber related events, as well as coordinate with other Federal agencies to provide specific warning information and advice on appropriate protective measures and countermeasures to State, Local and Tribal governments and to the private sector and critical infrastructure owners and operators. Responsible for the overall execution of the EINSTEIN cyber IT acquisition program. Formulate goals, plans, and policies governing the operation and use of DHS enterprise IT cyber-security systems, networks and data centers. Evaluate new technologies and make recommendations to the DHS Secretary, the Under Secretary for NPPD and the Assistant Secretary CS&C.

title: Chief
description: Provided day-to-day executive leadership and operational oversight and direction to various divisional elements. Exercised broad authority and responsibility for administrative and management policies, strategic planning, and program operations in the IT functions. Designed, deployed, operated, maintained and enhanced the agency's world-wide classified and unclassified networks and information systems, which span 38 locations and support over 8500 users. Managed over 200 personnel in support of this effort. Responsible for a broad array of technology related management services that are utilized by all entities within the DISA community. Provided technical and managerial leadership to divisional personnel in the development of new IT solutions and services that require the application of advanced technology. Worked in partnership with other DISA components, and business industry partners to conceptualize, discover, and develop new technologies that improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the DISA mission. Provided comprehensive testing services in support of systems; provided technical training and technical help desk support for all DISA systems; oversaw systems deployment support for technical systems implementations; oversaw the engineering, operations and maintenance of the DISA's e-mail system, the mobile device infrastructure, and the data warehousing system. Ensured security and information assurance principles, and practices are designed and engineered into the delivery of all IT services.

title: Senior Engineer
description: Personally requested by the DOD CIO to serve on a rotation to their office in support of the EW SE (Enterprise Wide Systems Engineering) effort. Served as a senior systems engineer in support of the Global Information Grid (GIG) for Enterprise Wide Systems Engineering (EWSE). Provided leadership of the various GIG working groups to support resolution of technical and IA issues relating to the IC integration with the GIG. Ensured end-to-end interoperability across more than $5 billion in programs and portfolios.

title: Program Manager
description: Operated and maintained the Intelligence Community's world-wide network. Managed the operations, and maintenance of the JWICS network to ensure required availability, cost effective operation, and existence of adequate disaster recovery plans and backup/redundant operations to meet national and defense intelligence needs. Oversaw the implementation of new technologies, such as a worldwide VTC, VoIP system, and a multi-classification thin client system.

title: Program Manager
description: Program Manager who leads several small to medium size Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) projects and a Department of Defense (DoD) Chief Information Officer (CIO) project for Technica. Responsible for preparation of sound work plans and budgets, assembling team to staff project, overseeing preparation of project deliverables and managing client relations. Manages project financials to ensure that projects fall within budget and meet financial metrics. Ensures timely and accurate preparation of invoices and collections. Manages client expectations and continuing client relationships at all levels. Supports preparation of qualification packages, managing proposal development, including project scoping, proposal approach, staffing plan, and pricing. Supports development of financial plans by providing projections of project revenue, sales, bookings and staff utilization. Supports the achievement of group’s financial targets through sound project execution, management of non-charge, business development, bid and proposal budgets, and management of staff utilization. •Supports and manages multi-million dollar projects for the following DISA and DoD customers with staff augmentation support and software development while working closely with Contracting Officer Representatives (COR), Senior Staff, and Lead Engineers. ◦DISA Enterprise Services Directorate (ESD), 2011 through 2014. ◦DISA Network Services (NS) Special Projects, 2011 to 2013. ◦DISA Program Executive Office – Mission Assurance 2 (PEO-MA2) Network Operations (NetOps), 2011 to 2014. ◦DISA NS2, 2014. ◦DISA Program Executive Office – Communications (PEO-COMMS), 2013 to 2014. ◦DoD CIO, 2011 through 2014.

title: IA Communications Specialist
description: Served as the Systems Planning, Engineering, and IA support for Range & Training Area Management (RTAM), TECOM, USMC. Supported RTAM Communications and Information Systems (CIS) duties and responsibilities, and performed duties associated with I/T Communications support, including planning, policy development, prioritization, programming, and re-sourcing pertaining to the standardizing, contracting, procurement, testing, integration, interoperability, installations, utilization, modification, maintenance, and life-cycle sustainment of Marine Corps Installations range instrumentation systems, range safety communications systems (i.e., Land Mobile Radio (LMR)), Range Control Facilities (RCF)s, Emergency Operations Centers, and various mobile wireless networked systems, facilities, and services for Marine Corps Range Controls and MAGTF organizations conducting training and testing on Marine Corps ranges and training facilities. Provided IA support for the certification and accreditation (C&A) of range systems to include Integrated Range Status System (IRSS), Enhanced Terminal Voice Switch (ETVS), Marine Corps Range and Training Area Management System (MCRTAMS), and Range Facilities Management Support System (RFMSS).

title: IA Tech MGT Officer Information Assurance/Computer Network Defense Task Monitor (IA/CND TM)
description: Information Assurance (IA) Tech MGT Officer (IA/CND TM) for DISA, PEO-IAN IA23 from August 2006 through March 2009. Oversaw the contracts for IA23 projects. Provided coordination between projects and resources to ensure project success. Created Statement of Work (SOW) and Independent Government Cost Estimate (IGCE). Developed Financial Program Plans for projects and worked with the business office to ensure that financial packages and follow on contracts for projects were submitted correctly and in a timely manner. Provided, developed, and delivered informational project briefings to government executives. Supervised, managed, and/or provided guidance on contracts and dealings with vendors such as BAE Systems, McAfee, Technica, General Dynamics, Northrop Grumman, Apptis and CDW Government. • Performed Task Monitor (TM) duties on IA/CND contracts by monitoring technical progress, administrative/cost aspects, and subcontracting of the assigned contract. Resolved technical differences, assisted in closeout upon completion of work, and maintained/documented contractor performance. • Performed as the Primary TM and Project Management Assistant for the $16M Host Based Security System (HBSS) Project, the largest recorded deployment of software across the DoD. Managed a multi-disciplined project team of 9 contractors. Coordinated and Managed the development of the acquisition program plan for the HBSS project from Fiscal Year (FY) 09-FY13, consisting over $16 million per FY. • Also performed as Program Manager for a $2.5M IA/CND sensor project. Reviewed project requirements, architectural, and technical conceptual documentation. Developed project schedules and budgets. Interfaced with government staff and provided briefings. Managed a multi-disciplined project team of 4 contractors and 1 consultant. Monitored project to ensure scope, schedule, and budget are defined and maintained. Identified issues, risks, and formulated solutions.

title: Vice President, DISA and Air Force Programs/Account Executive for Air Force and DISA
description: Responsible for Capture, Management and Customer Facing for DISA and AF opportunities. • Capture on number of DISA, USTRANSCOM and AF opportunities, building teams, influencing acquisition strategy, developing capture plans and tracking through proposal development and response • Building the market penetration strategy for ECS to move into DISA and AF arenas, new focus areas for the company looking to expand footprint in DOD • Business development activities within the AF in “branding” ECS as a company to be looked at and looked for in their contractual dealing. Provide access to key leaders with DISA and the AF, specifically DISA HQ, SAF/A6 staff, AFNIC, AFSPC and other MAJCOM A6s, the ANG, ESC and 24AF

summary: Experience built upon 24+ years of military service in telecommunications and over 5 years of business operations and program management. Seasoned leader in bridging between entities/views, Operations/Program Management, strategic planning, process improvement, and business and productivity increases. Experiences include enterprise services, global communications, information assurance, network operations and resource planning/management. Operationally oreinted, focused on the customer mission and satisfaction as we execute the programs with the utmost efficiency. An industry leader responsible for providing AFNetOps/Cyber services and solutions to DoD organizations.Specialties:• Leadership & Strategic Planning • Capture • Proposal Management • Bridging views/resolving issues • Building & Managing Teams • How technology applies to operational objectives in a highly classified environment • Program Management (P/L; FFP; LH) • Network Operations & Management • Enterprise Services

title: Vice President, Operations
description: Serving as the VP for AF operations managing programs and projects throughout the US. Main offices in Montgomery AL, Dayton OH and Battle Creek MI. Managing AF programs include firm fixed price and labor hour contracts focused on AF Network Operations (NetOps) and Cyber operations and security. Responsible for the IT infrastucture upgrade for Hickam AFB Hawaii. Integral to the building of the NETCENTS 2 team and proposal and upon award, the operations of the project managment office (PMO). Manage the operations of the NETCENTS 1 PMO. Won contracts supporting the DCGS program and the 2nd Generation Wireless installations and upgrades.

summary: Experience built upon 24+ years of military service in telecommunications and over 5 years of business operations and program management. Seasoned leader in bridging between entities/views, Operations/Program Management, strategic planning, process improvement, and business and productivity increases. Experiences include enterprise services, global communications, information assurance, network operations and resource planning/management. Operationally oreinted, focused on the customer mission and satisfaction as we execute the programs with the utmost efficiency. An industry leader responsible for providing AFNetOps/Cyber services and solutions to DoD organizations.Specialties:• Leadership & Strategic Planning • Capture • Proposal Management • Bridging views/resolving issues • Building & Managing Teams • How technology applies to operational objectives in a highly classified environment • Program Management (P/L; FFP; LH) • Network Operations & Management • Enterprise Services

title: Program Manager/Capture Manager
description: My first experience in the civilian sector, working as a program manager and AF SME. I was managing programs and working on proposals in bidding in areas of AF IT and NSA. After only about 7 months was handpicked to the the NETCENTS 2 Capture Manager. Building the teams to go after both the NetOps and Application Services opportunities. • Handpicked as Capture manager for the NETCENTS 2 bid, ($9B IDIQ) after only 7 months on the job—building the team and influencing the opportunity to ensure a Prime position • Business development activities within the AF in “branding” SRA as a company to be looked at and looked for in their contractual dealing. Provide access to key leaders with the AF, specifically AF/XC staff, AFCA, AMC, AETC, AFSPC and other MAJCOM A6s, the ANG, ESC, AFCYBER(P) and key leaders at 554 ELSW • Took over a troubled program and got it on track. Program needed leadership, strong direction, control and organization. Brought all these factors together and moved the program quickly from a “Yellow” to a “Green” • Diligently worked a number of RFP responses and worked as part of the team on others, lending technical and operational experience and expertise to the prop--turning tech speak into an operationally related discussion on how we would meet their mission requirements and deliver true combat capabilities

description: Career communications officer. Final assignment as Chief Global Enterprise Command Center at NSA, Ft Meade.

title: Chief, Global Enterprise Command Center – Senior Operations Management/Change Leader
description: Led a 60-member team of information technology professionals managing overseeing the NSA worldwide communications infrastructure to ensure the successful operations of the signal intelligence (SIGINT) mission. • Spearheaded Directorate-level initiatives implementing new ideas for improved enterprise services and operations, focusing on building standard processes and procedures. Trusted counselor to senior IT decision-makers moving NSA forward to realize the operational benefits of a true IT enterprise • Established mission-oriented bridge between SIGINT operations and IT services. Brought sense of mission to system restorals and oversight – key to building cohesion and confidence where none existed • Built team of technical workcenters into one; cross-collaboration and coordination to handle any event and keep the SIGINT mission operational

summary: Experience built upon 24+ years of military service in telecommunications and over 5 years of business operations and program management. Seasoned leader in bridging between entities/views, Operations/Program Management, strategic planning, process improvement, and business and productivity increases. Experiences include enterprise services, global communications, information assurance, network operations and resource planning/management. Operationally oreinted, focused on the customer mission and satisfaction as we execute the programs with the utmost efficiency. An industry leader responsible for providing AFNetOps/Cyber services and solutions to DoD organizations.Specialties:• Leadership & Strategic Planning • Capture • Proposal Management • Bridging views/resolving issues • Building & Managing Teams • How technology applies to operational objectives in a highly classified environment • Program Management (P/L; FFP; LH) • Network Operations & Management • Enterprise Services

description: Communications Operations Directorate, Deputy Chief of Staff Installation and Logistics, HQ AF, Pentagon Led premiere division providing strategic oversight of AF comm operations, to include critical areas of Information Assurance, Network Operations, Space Operations, Deployed Comm Operations, Multi-media and Postal. description: Team resource that provides application support to end users to include break fix, requests for information and account servicing. title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Developing an enterprise application for NASA SEWP V that allows contract holders, customers, and team members to manage data, enter data, analyze data, and collaborate. Tool development requires knowledge of Java J2EE, Spring, MyBatis, Oracle, Bootstrap, BackBone, Jquery, and JavaScript. The application is developed using two methods, one is Spring MVC with JSP, the other is REST Services. Application deployed on JBOSS, with ActiveMQ to manage email request. Knowledge of MyBatis and SQL required for querying database. Bootstrap used for interface, along with BackBone for AJAX functionality. Assist program management by developing a schedule of deliverables. Use MS Project and QuickBase to enter task and manage resources for a team of 9 developers. Lead weekly team status meetings. Coordinate efforts for application test, customer demonstrations, and deployments. Report status of project to project management via RAG charts, and discrepancy reports. Provided mentorship and technical leadership to junior staff.

title: Senior Software Test Engineer
description: Testing signal processing systems by constructing automated test scripts. Develop perl/shell/expect scripts to test integrated systems. Scripts are used to configure and load hardware devices, configure routers and network devices, and publish any metrics to files. Configure automated test tool, developed in house, to test varying criteria. Configure Juniper router interface cards to produce required signal rates for testing. Administer and install Linux on servers. Tested web-based applications developed using People Soft to provide human recourse management and workforce development and training systems. Test plans drafted to IEEE standards and presented to customer and development team prior to testing. System level test performed to verify customer requirements were met by development team and the tool functioned per requirement specifications. Test plan and scripting developed using Mercury Quality Center. Mercury Quality Center used to perform and track test, as well as, to track discrepancies and usable issues detected during testing. Test summary drafted to IEEE standards and presented to customer and development team to highlight test results and risk assessment should the application be deployed. Lead small test teams, assigning tasks and tracking progress. As team lead, responsibilities also included drafting the final version of the test plan and test summary report and coordinating testing effort with develop team. Testing required knowledge of sql to query Oracle database for data validation as well as PeopleSoft administration knowledge. Integrated systems to use an enterprise service bus architecture to manage data flow and processing over a distributed system. Applications developed in Java and JMX to perform statics gathering across a ServiceMix bus.

title: Real Estate Agent
description: Vanessa Franklin is a REMAX Results agent with over twenty years of real estate experience, serving clients with one of their largest investments in life; the buying and selling of their homes. Committed to excellence and professionally skilled, you’ll find that Vanessa will personally work with each client throughout the entire transaction and has an excellent closing history with a high degree of client satisfaction and referral. Vanessa has years of stress free relocation, short sale and foreclosure experience. She has been granted the right to use the professional designation G.R.I. (Graduate, REALTOR Institute) by the National Association of Realtors and has received certification in Historic Properties. She is a member of the Education Committee for the Frederick County Association of Realtors. Her specialty service areas include Frederick, Washington, Montgomery, Howard and Carroll Counties. Her philosophy is . . ."It's just as easy to be positive as it is to be negative. Look for the positive in every experience and you'll find it".
